intro: Morisonia linearis, commonly known as the slender morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its linear, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stems. Morisonia linearis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
